basis: The user consistently expresses ultra-simple plans and low-pressure commitments, but has a history of minimal follow-through and delays in acting on similar prompts. This suggests a low likely action despite verbal intent.
coaching_notes: Lean into ultra-micro commitments and concrete prompts. Suggest scheduling a specific time window for the check-in, or use an automatic reminder. Explore barriers to eating and action (distress, appetite issues, energy). Consider using a single-step cue (e.g., text first, then a tiny bite) and plan a quick follow-up check-in to reassess readiness.
